steps.title: Locate your newsgroup reader.
steps.content: Locate your newsgroup reader. Windows Vista and Windows 7 provide newsreaders in Windows Mail. In older versions of Windows, look for your newsreader in Outlook Express. Otherwise, access newsgroups through one of the many portals on the Internet. Some popular newsgroups include Usenet.org, Google Groups, and Yahoo! Groups. Mac users have various options to download, including Unison, NewsFire, and NewsHunter.

steps.title: Open your newsreader.
steps.content: Open your newsreader. In Windows Mail, find "Newsgroups" under "Tools" on the Menu bar. If you're accessing newsgroups through another server, follow the instructions to create a newsgroup server account. Some public newsgroups require downloading a specific newsgroup reader. Others like Google Groups allow users to access Usenet through their site.

steps.title: Subscribe to a group or two that interests you.
steps.content: Subscribe to a group or two that interests you. These subjects can be as broad or specific as you want. For example, you can join a guitar group or a Rickenbacker guitar newsgroup. The newsgroup server will show all available newsgroups available on the server. In Windows Mail, choose a newsgroup, and click subscribe. Google Group users click on subjects, and then subcategories until finding the right one. Mac users can open up choices by clicking on a newsgroup so that a minus sign or downward arrow appears. Once a user finds a newsgroup to join, it's just a matter of clicking on subscribe.

steps.title: Search for specific newsgroups by inserting a keyword or keywords into the newsgroup search box.
steps.content: Search for specific newsgroups by inserting a keyword or keywords into the newsgroup search box. The search will reveal all groups that fit.

steps.title: Create a new newsgroup if you can't locate the specific topic that you're looking for, but you'll have to have an account with a news server.
steps.content: Create a new newsgroup if you can't locate the specific topic that you're looking for, but you'll have to have an account with a news server. With Google and Yahoo!, it's as simple as signing up with your email address .

steps.title: Post questions and comments on topics that interest you or join discussion forums.
steps.content: Post questions and comments on topics that interest you or join discussion forums. The newsgroup information will appear in your e-mail window if you are using Windows Mail or in your browser window. Some newsgroup servers also allow users the option of receiving news as separate emails or summarized in a digest format.

steps.title: Unsubscribe to newsgroups that you no longer have an interest for or that aren't meeting your needs.
steps.content: Unsubscribe to newsgroups that you no longer have an interest for or that aren't meeting your needs.
